title: Sara Sharif's father told police he killed her at home, court hears
description: Urfan Sharif claims his wife caused Sara's death and he was trying to protect her, a jury hears.

title: Gregg Wallace denies inappropriate sexual comments
description: Wallace says an incident was investigated, and the outcome was "I hadn't said anything sexual".

title: ‘I lost £165k to fraud in an hour’ - customers say they were let down by Revolut
description: Revolut was named in more complaints about fraud last year than any of the UK’s biggest banks or e-money services.

title: Australia state premiers accused of 'insulting' King for not attending reception
description: Monarchists in Australia accuse state premiers of "insulting" King Charles by not attending a reception.

title: Starmer defends workers' rights as 'pro-growth'
description: The prime minister also tells a major business summit he will scrap regulation that "holds back investment".

title: Israeli shelling of Gaza school kills at least 22
description: Gaza's Hamas-run Civil Defence Agency said the site was struck by a volley of artillery on Sunday.

title: Officer 'filled with dread' before Kaba shooting
description: Chris Kaba was shot in the head by a police marksman after being stopped in south London.

title: Strictly's Wynne heartbroken over 'stupid joke'
description: Viewers noticed some apparently awkward moments between the opera singer and his partner Katya Jones.

title: Angry India recalls envoy over 'preposterous' Canada investigation
description: India said its diplomats were named as "persons of interest" in a criminal investigation in Canada.

title: BBC boss warns of Russian and Chinese propaganda due to World Service cuts

title: BBC News app
description: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Thousands of cars that crash in US are ending up in Russia

title: WWE’s Cody Rhodes wants WrestleMania to be hosted in UK within next five years
description: The "American Nightmare" thinks Manchester or London have venues perfect for hosting the event.

description: The BBC's Pallab Ghosh explores why this world first test is a big deal for space exploration.

title: Man says he has been 'left to rot' after Covid vaccine

title: A Japanese boy was killed in China. Was cyber-nationalism to blame?
description: The Chinese government has been accused of using online nationalism as a useful safety valve.

description: Rebekah Morris, 29, sent a picture of a field of cows moments before her death, an inquest is told.

title: Five beheaded bodies found next to road in Mexico

title: Briton died while climbing bridge for  social media, Spanish authorities say

title: Parts of UK forecast to see temperatures jump to 20C this week
description: Parts of the country could see a 10C bump in temperatures in the short period of fine weather.

title: Ex-Stasi officer jailed for 1974 Berlin border killing
